judges: Before Maxey, C. J.; Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Parker and Stearne, JJ.

opinions.text:
Per Curiam,
The decree is affirmed on the opinion of President Judge Gordon of the court below.
Costs to be paid by appellants.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: A. E. Hurshman, for The Tabor Presbyterian Church of the City of Philadelphia, appellant.
William N. Ottinger, for Albert D. C. Mcllroy, a creditor, appellant.
Edward F. Hitchcock, for The Presbytery of Philadelphia of the Presbyterian Church, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Tabor Presbyterian Church Dissolution Case.
Argued April 21, 1943.
Before Maxey, C. J.; Drew, Linn, Stern, Patterson, Parker and Stearne, JJ.
A. E. Hurshman, for The Tabor Presbyterian Church of the City of Philadelphia, appellant.
William N. Ottinger, for Albert D. C. Mcllroy, a creditor, appellant.
Edward F. Hitchcock, for The Presbytery of Philadelphia of the Presbyterian Church, appellee.
May 10, 1943:
